title: üé≠ Roleplay - Service Simulation
lead: Practice your service skills! You are the SAC attendant and must choose the best answers.

completion.title: Congratulations!
completion.correct_count: You got {correct} out of {total} answers right

results.good: Very well! You are on the right track!
results.average: Good, but you can improve. Review the content!
results.needs_work: Needs more study. Review the course modules!

steps.name: Introduction
steps.client_speech: Hello, good afternoon! I bought this blender here yesterday and would like to exchange it for another model.

options.text: Good afternoon! Sure, I can help you with that. Does the product have any defect or problem?
options.feedback: Excellent! You greeted the customer cordially and already asked an important question to understand the situation.

options.text: Unfortunately, it is not possible to exchange products that have already been bought and taken home.
options.feedback: This answer is very negative and does not welcome the customer. We must always first understand the situation before denying something.

options.text: You can leave the product on the counter and someone will check it for you later.
options.feedback: This answer is too informal and shows no interest in helping the customer. Service must always be cordial and professional.

steps.name: Customer Question
steps.client_speech: No, it is not defective. I just saw another model that I liked more. I saw on the internet that I have the right to exchange within 7 days, right?

options.text: Yes, for sure! You have this right guaranteed by law. Let's make the exchange right now.
options.feedback: Careful! The 7-day right of repentance only applies to ONLINE purchases. In a physical store, exchange is a commercial policy, not a legal right.

options.text: The 7-day right applies to online purchases. In physical stores, it is a courtesy. I can check our policy!
options.feedback: Perfect! You correctly explained the difference between the legal right (online purchases) and commercial policy (physical store), without refusing to help the customer.

options.text: That 7-day rule is only for online purchases, so it doesn't apply here. Sorry.
options.feedback: Although the info about online is correct, the answer is too negative. We should always look for alternatives to help the customer.

steps.name: Additional Doubt
steps.client_speech: Ah, I see... so you won't exchange it? And if the product has a defect later, can I complain?

options.text: Yes, you can! For defects, you have 90 days. And our policy allows exchange in 30 days with the invoice!
options.feedback: Excellent! You correctly informed the 90-day deadline to complain about defects in durable products AND also offered the possibility of exchange by company policy.

options.text: For defects you can complain, but the deadline is only 7 days after purchase.
options.feedback: Incorrect! The deadline to complain about defects in durable products is 90 DAYS, not 7 days.

options.text: If the product has no defect now, later we can't do anything, unfortunately.
options.feedback: Incorrect! Hidden defects (defects that appear later) can be claimed within 90 days for durable products.

steps.name: Closing
steps.client_speech: That's great! So can I exchange it for the other model? The product is still sealed and I have the invoice.

options.text: I can't make the exchange because, as I explained, it is not a legal obligation of the store.
options.feedback: Inappropriate answer. The customer meets the requirements of the commercial policy (sealed product + invoice).

options.text: With sealed product and invoice, I can make the exchange! Which model do you prefer?
options.feedback: Congratulations! You finished the service positively, confirming that the customer meets the requirements and proceeding with the exchange.

options.text: I need to call my manager to authorize this type of exchange procedure here.
options.feedback: Unnecessary in this case. As the customer meets the policy requirements (sealed + invoice), you can resolve it without needing to escalate.
